entry.title: Teaching how to code is broken
entry.quote: Imagine if aliens landed on earth and we teach them everything about the shape of a fork, its material, how its made, typical ways of holding it, various shapes of forks, its history, and etymology, but never tell them that a fork is used to pick up food and stick it in the mouth.

entry.title: Wordle founder Josh Wardle on going viral and what comes next

entry.title: Architect behind Googleplex now says it's 'dangerous' to work at such a posh office
entry.quote: He said blurring the line between work and non-work keeps employees tethered to the office, benefiting the employer most of all. That, he argues, may seem to keep workers happy but can quickly spark burnout.

entry.title: SPOTLIGHT: 100 Days of Happiness
entry.quote: 2022 has just started and I’m taking stock of the last year, of achievements, loved ones, and things to work on. Have I lived at my best last year? Have I done everything I could to be happy? What actually happened in 2021?

entry.title: Why visual literacy is essential to good data visualization
entry.quote: “Most of us need to listen to the music to understand how beautiful it is. But often that’s how we present statistics: we just show the notes, we don’t play the music.”
